definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To make pits in; to mark with little hollows.
examples: Exposure to acid rain pitted the metal.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To put (an animal) into a pit for fighting.
( transitive ) To bring (something) into opposition with something else.
examples: Are you ready to pit your wits against one of the world's greatest puzzles?

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , motor racing ) To return to the pits during a race for refuelling, tyre changes, repairs etc.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make pits in; to mark with little hollows.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To put (an animal) into a pit for fighting.
( transitive ) To bring (something) into opposition with something else.
( intransitive , motor racing ) To return to the pits during a race for refuelling, tyre changes, repairs etc.

definitions.definition: To remove the stone from a stone fruit or the shell from a drupe.
examples: One must pit a peach to make it ready for a pie.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To remove the stone from a stone fruit or the shell from a drupe.
